GeneralInformation.School Vision: Yuhualite -One who Cares, Shares and ContributesOne who Learns, Thinks and Innovates
GeneralInformation.School Philosophy, Culture and Ethos: The school believes that every pupil is different, each has his unique talent and the ability to learn.  As such, the school seeks to create a learning environment whereby their learning experiences are both meaningful and purposeful to engage their hearts and minds so that every Yuhualite will be a thinking individual who cares and contributes to the community and the country.  Underpinning this belief is the school mission, vision and values: Resilience, Responsibility, Respect, Integrity, Care and Harmony
GeneralInformation.Type of School: GOVERNMENT SCHOOL / CO-ED SCHOOL / SINGLE SESSION

School Distinctive Programmes.Music & Performing Arts: Building Good Character through Music and the Performing Arts

SpecialProgrammes.Special Student Development Programmes O: Learning for Life Programme (LLP): Building Good Character through Music and the Performing Arts  Yuhua Primary School recognises the importance of music in nurturing well-rounded individuals and the opportunities that Music curriculum can provide in preparing pupils for life. The school has a 6-year plan for their Music and Performing Arts programmes, catering to pupils from different levels of musical inclinations. The programme has been recognised by MOE as a distinctive programme under the LLP since 2014 and it aims to further develop their pupils' passion for lifelong learning through its Music and the Performing Arts programme, grounded in values.  The school has a Music Garden to facilitate the teaching and learning of Music through outdoor musical installations in an outdoor environment.  The outdoor education learning facility enhances the formal Music curricula and supports the school's effort to build good character through Music and the Performing Arts.  School-based Innovation  The school has an innovation programme which aims to develop pupils in the 21st Century Competencies.  A theme is set for each level with specially customized programme to equip their pupils with the necessary skills through the Information and Communications Technology (ICT)-enriched lessons and authentic learning experiences at difference stages of their learning.  The programme requires pupils to think innovatively and communicate confidently while working independently or collaborating in teams.   The school also adopted Paul's Wheel of Reasoning model to provide a focus in developing their pupils' critical and creative thinking (CCT) skills.   The innovation programme facilitates developing pupils' talents in the area of innovation and enterprise (I&E). It aims to extend the learning within the curriculum further for I&E. Through the programme, pupils learn to identify and apply ideation and problem solving-techniques to be an innovator and entrepreneur.
